title: Iterative Instructional Design Course for Strengthening Simulation-Based Social Problem-Solving Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Simulating Professional Roles in Medical, Legal, and Technical Fields to Iteratively Learn Decision-Making for Societal Problem-Solving

learning_goals: Learners can derive optimal resolution strategies through iterative design by analyzing social conflict scenarios at least three times in a simulation environment
Learners improve problem-solving skills by revising simulation design errors at least twice based on peer feedback
Learners can reconstruct simulation designs when new information (e.g., legal revisions) is provided and propose alternatives applicable to real-world contexts
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
